help.title: Review workspace help
help.intro: Use this screen to review, edit, and regenerate the audio/text segments of the selected project while monitoring their status.

navigation.title: Navigation & file info
items: The header shows the current project name plus a “Back to project” button to return to the main page.
The file info block indicates which audio/JSON pair is loaded and how many segments are available.

playback.title: Playback & timeline
items: Use the top Play button to start/stop audio; during playback it switches to Pause.
Scroll sideways on the waveform with the mouse wheel or touchpad; the timeline adapts automatically to long recordings.
Blue highlights are Wavesurfer regions: click to preview a section or drag the edges to fine-tune start/end points.

editing.title: Editing segments
items: Each segment has original and translated text fields that auto-resize, making long sentences easier to read.
Playback pauses when you focus a field; changes are saved automatically when you leave the field or press Enter.
Virtual scrolling ensures only visible segments are rendered so large projects stay responsive.

operations.title: Segment operations
items: Right-click any colored bar to open the context menu for inserting, deleting, or triggering TTS regeneration.
When inserting a segment the system refreshes numbering and, if needed, fetches fresh data from the server.
Deleting a segment also removes the visual highlights and Wavesurfer region so the UI stays in sync.

tts.title: TTS & audio handling
items: The Play button on each segment is enabled only when a synthesized clip exists. Clicking it launches the AudioTrimmer modal.
If there is no TTS yet, the button is greyed out and shows No TTS as a reminder to regenerate audio.
After regeneration the UI refreshes automatically so the button reflects the newly available clip.

regeneration.title: Tracking regeneration
items: Starting Regenerate (TTS) opens the log modal, which displays the live status of the background job.
Once the job finishes successfully the modal auto-closes, but you can dismiss it manually at any time.

tips.title: Helpful tips
items: For long sessions let scrolling lazily load segments—the background optimization keeps performance high.
If an error occurs the interface shows feedback, and using the refresh actions pulls the latest data from the server.
